edu.up.cs301.animation
Class AnimationSurface

java.lang.Object
  SurfaceView
      edu.up.cs301.animation.AnimationSurface

public class AnimationSurface
extends SurfaceView

A SurfaceView which allows which an animation to be drawn on it by a Animator.

Version:
July 2013
Author:
Steve Vegdahl, Andrew Nuxoll

          Constructor for the AnimationSurface class.

Constructor Detail

AnimationSurface

public AnimationSurface(Context context)
Constructor for the AnimationSurface class. In order to be useful, an object must be supplied that implements the Animator interface. This can either be done by overriding the 'createAnimator' method (which by default give null, or by invoking the setAnimator method.

Parameters:
context - - a reference to the activity this animation is run under

AnimationSurface

public AnimationSurface(Context context,
                        AttributeSet attrs)
An alternate constructor for use when a subclass is directly specified in the layout. It is expected that the subclass will have overridden the 'createAnimator' method.

Parameters:
context - - a reference to the activity this animation is run under
attrs - - set of attributes passed from system
Method Detail

createAnimator

public Animator createAnimator()
Creates the animator for the object. If this method returns null, then it will be necessary to invoke the 'setAnimator' method before the animation can start.

Returns:
the animator

setAnimator

public void setAnimator(Animator animator)
Sets and starts the animator for the AnimationSurface if it does not already have an animator.

Parameters:
animator - the animator to use.

flash

public void flash(int color,
                  int millis)
Causes the background color to flash (change color) for the specified amount of time.

Parameters:
color - the color to flash
millis - the number of milliseconds to flash

onTouch

public boolean onTouch(View v,
                       MotionEvent event)
if I am touched, pass the touch event to the animator
